intro: Melochia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca melochia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Melochia oaxacana is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
